title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: Prime Minister Scott Morrison has defended Home Affairs Minister Peter Dutton, who angered China with comments about the Communist Party. According to Sky News contributor Janine Perrett, “the biggest issue this year has been the rise of China and the threat from a security perspective.” The Chinese embassy condemned Mr Dutton for using a so-called "malicious slur" and damaging the two nations' relationship. Mr Dutton is being criticised for suggesting Australia has the right to "call out" countries for skirting the law or threatening democratic values. Image: News Corp Australia
